FuncDef: The display aaa abnormal-offline-record command displays the abnormal logout record.
CLIs: display aaa abnormal-offline-record user-id <integer-value> [ nop | count <integer-value> ]
display aaa abnormal-offline-record offline-reason { flow-limit | session-timeout }
display aaa abnormal-offline-record offline-reason { flow-limit | session-timeout } brief

ParaDef.Info:
Displays abnormal offline records about a user. During record displaying, you do not need to enter Y or N to check whether to display the next record.
-

Specifies the number of abnormal offline records to be displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65536.

Indicates the specified offline reason according to which the logout record is queried.
-

Indicates the offline reason is flow limit to be queried.
-

Indicates the offline reason is session timeout to be queried.
-

Displays brief information of the abnormal offline records.
-

Specifies a user ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295 .

Examples: User offline reason: Session time out
Are you sure to display some information?(Y/N)[Y]:
ExtraInfo:
You can query the abnormal logout records by specifying the user ID or the offline reason.
After you run the display aaa abnormal-offline-record command, abnormal logout records are displayed if such records exist, regardless of whether you have run the undo aaa abnormal-offline-record command.
